title: Great culture, teams run lean, growth opportunities limited
pros: Great culture - collaborative and generally good people Team runs lean so you get do own more but means hard work and long hours (potentially)
cons: Growth opportunities limited, some managers need work

title: Really impressed with this company
pros: After spending a decade in big tech, I was surprised to find a company that takes many of the great attributes and leaves the negative aspects of many other big Silicon Valley corporations (in my experience since being here 1.5 years). From the comprehensive (and fun!) multi-day, in-person onboarding trainings, to company-wide volunteer days (IMPACT Day), social events that embrace different cultures and celebrate diversity - Prologis is a company that invests in its employees. I also appreciate that it routinely asks employees what it can do better, and listens. Teams are continually driving towards excellence - whether that‚Äôs finding a more effective process or implementing new technology to help teams work smarter. But in my experience, being ‚Äúhuman‚Äù is still valued. People lead with kindness and empathy in a way that feels really genuine. The cascading effect creates a team dynamic that is pretty rare in my experience.
cons: For those that love remote work, we‚Äôre currently in the office 3x/week (may vary based on the team). At least the snacks are good :)

title: Not too good, Not too bad
pros: Work-life balance is great, lots of PTO and holidays, rarely working a full 40 hours, great office location, and perks
cons: Very lean company with lots of turnover, constant reshuffling of department structure, fast-paced, and very easy to get behind

title: Energizing People and Portfolios
pros: Working at Prologis has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my career. The company truly values both its clients and employees, and that shows up in everything we do. What I appreciate most is how grounded we are in our core values of integrity, accountability, passion and teamwork while always looking ahead and embracing change. I‚Äôve felt empowered to ask bold questions, bring new ideas forward and collaborate with incredibly thoughtful and driven teammates. The culture here is proactive, supportive and genuinely human. Prologis doesn't just talk about making an impact, we live it every day together
cons: Prologis moves at such a fast pace and sets a high bar for performance, it can take time to adjust if you're new to the industry or not used to cross-functional collaboration. The environment expects proactive thinking, which is incredibly rewarding, but also requires you to stay sharp and flexible.

title: Acquisitions and Development Analyst
pros: - Lots of responsibility given to their employees. Team provides you lots of real, impactful work. - As an analyst in your first year, you can be playing a significant role on very large transactions. - Incredibly supportive culture that helps you learn and is open to you asking questions (incredibly rare to find in finance facing roles). - Unbelievable exposure to wide range of business lines. - Be at the cusp of innovation with the commercial real estate business, AI in real estate, ect.
cons: - Lots of quarterly projects that the analysts have to handle and complete due to being a large public company.

title: Horrible Place to Work
pros: They promote people fast if you are a part of their clique. Good work life balance if they like you.
cons: I had the worst experience working here. I was blindsided with a poor performance review and given vague, unhelpful feedback that made no sense. My boss excluded me from meetings, spoke to me poorly, and held grudges whenever I made mistakes. Leadership encouraged me to ‚Äúkeep improving,‚Äù and offered to mentor me only to lay me off six months later. The VP was incompetent and openly said horrible things about her employees, while showing favoritism toward men in the office. Overall, leadership is a joke unprofessional, toxic, and completely lacking in accountability. I'm not sure how my boss thinks she is a good one. No diversity either and not accpeting of different kinds of people. I was told I don't fit in

title: Prologis is a great place to work!
pros: I have only been here for a couple months but the culture at Prologis is amazing! It truly feels like a connected team and everyone is very willing to help/support each other. Given the scale and size of the company, the opportunities for growth or development are endless, especially if you have a natural curiosity to explore potential solutions. The benefits package far exceeds any of my previous employers.
cons: Work from home is available and possible but given the need for significant team interaction and culture development there is limited work from home opportunities

title: Continuing excellence
pros: The workplace community and colleagues is one Prologis' greatest strengths. Everyone is expected to work hard, but doing so with a team you value makes a big difference. Innovation is a constant - team members are encouraged and expected to try what has not been done before.
cons: Prologis is not for employees looking for a static environment.

title: Great place to work
pros: Good people and culture here
cons: It you don't perform you will struggle.

title: Prologis is a great place to work!
pros: Culture - It's the reason I am still here after almost 13yrs. People - You will be challenged and pushed as you are surrounded by truly the best in the industry. Expect change, its a differentiator for us and our people and its constant... which means you will always be learnign something new. Innovative - We welcome new ideas and are eager to find better ways of doing things. This is a culture that welcomes innovative ideas that challenge the status quo. Offices - The offices are all newly remodeled and provide a welcoming, unique feel that attracts top talent in the markets we serve. Inclusive - We have an incredibly diverse workforce which provides a welcoming and inclusive work environment where all voices are welcomed and heard.
cons: Challenging/Expect Constant Change - Not for everyone as we are looking for people who are willing to push themselves to maximize their potential and grow together. This is a place to create a career, not just have a job.

title: Great company
pros: Company has an outsized global impact to the size of its employee population. The innovation we're doing keeps our employees both energized and proud. Leadership prioritizes employee communications and is highly focused on nurturing a strong culture.
cons: More of a sign of the times than specific to Prologis, but recognize people sometimes feel like work/life balance can challenging. Most managers pay close attention to that to ensure employees do feel that support in managing workload in a fast-paced, exciting work environment.

title: Refreshing corporate and team environment
pros: I feel proud to work at Prologis. The leaders that I've interacted with are open and involved but not overburdening. Fellow team members are kind, welcoming and reliable. Overall a great work environment.
cons: Medical benefits could be better - the network of doctors we have access to isn't great (ex: seems like most of them aren't accepting new patients). Flexibility/sentiment around the days in office policy seems to vary from person to person as well.

title: Great people! Great place to work!
pros: The people here are genuinely smart, dynamic, and passionate. The collaborative environment is very different from the competition you normally see in a bull pen. You are truly supported in what you do. One of the quotes at Prologis is "Fail fast", this means that it is great to make mistakes as long as you learn from them. It is a great place to grow!
cons: Prologis is a very global company, so you would probably be working on a project overseas at some point - it can be difficult across time zones and connecting with people you have never met in person.

title: The type of company you want to work at for decades
pros: Dedicated, brilliant and engaged leadership team, amazing work-life balance, competitive pay and agile teams.
cons: Not necessarily a con because it is just a part of being at such a fast-growing company, but there could be strong communication across business lines. This is something that the company is clearly working on as a part of its strategic growth of new business lines.

title: Real Culture. Amazing People.
pros: The culture here is truly special. People are kind, authentic, and genuinely invested in one another‚Äôs success. It's not uncommon to meet colleagues who‚Äôve been here for 5, 10, even 15+ years‚Äîsomething that feels almost unheard of these days. That kind of longevity speaks to how much people care about the work and each other. Access to leadership is another standout‚Äîour C-suite is approachable, down to earth, and easy to talk to. It‚Äôs a highly collaborative environment where integrity and doing what‚Äôs right (especially for the planet) are more than just stated values‚Äîthey‚Äôre part of the day-to-day decision-making.
cons: Like any fast-moving company, things can change quickly, and sometimes communication doesn‚Äôt always keep pace. Cross-functional alignment can occasionally be a challenge as teams navigate shifting priorities. Also, because so many people stay here long term, career movement can feel slower unless you actively seek out new opportunities or advocate for your own growth.

title: Great Perks Heavy Work Load
pros: Company has lots of perks. Snacks lunches outings etc. Remote day.
cons: Pretty unrealistic work load. They ask a lot of their employees and aren‚Äôt the best with training their leadership.

title: Mission-Driven Industry Leader with Great People and a Few Growing Pains
pros: Prologis is the clear leader in its space, with a product and reputation that customers love. The company has strong ethical standards, led by principled leadership that prioritizes integrity in deal-making. The CEO is both sharp and approachable, setting a thoughtful tone from the top. Offices are beautiful, and employee benefits and events are well thought out. Workplace flexibility is real‚Äîmost teams are empowered to choose how they work best. I genuinely enjoy working with my teammates and managers; the people here are kind, smart, and collaborative.
cons: Compensation doesn‚Äôt always feel competitive given the caliber of talent and the company‚Äôs performance. Some senior leaders could be more engaged in fostering individual's growth and management development. New business lines sometimes launch without the necessary resourcing or clear strategic alignment, which can create inefficiencies and internal churn.

title: Strong culture and teamwork
pros: Prologis‚Äô strong culture makes me proud to work here and motivates me to bring my best every day. Teamwork is built on trust and open communication.
cons: There is opportunity to strengthen cross-functional collaboration and relationships,

title: I'm very happy to work here
pros: Great company with strong record of performance + supportive team + incredible boss + awesome compensation package.
cons: The 5-day work week. I wish we had the option to do (4) 10-hour days instead. Most companies don't have that, but it's the only con I can think of!

title: High-speed, high-autonomy environment with the right balance of structure
pros: A company where you can move fast, take ownership, and still count on solid support systems.
cons: Fast-pace isn‚Äôt for everyone. Less hand-holding. Evolving processes can be tough to navigate. Workload balance can fluctuate. Not a fit for everyone.

title: So many opportunities!
pros: -Supportive and collaborative colleagues -Wide range of career growth opportunities -Excellent benefits package -Engaging and enjoyable office events -Modern and well-designed office spaces -Leadership that genuinely values and supports employees
cons: I'm still fairly new, so no cons so far...

title: Purpose-Driven Company That Invests in People and Culture
pros: Strong leadership and transparent communication Supportive and inclusive work culture Commitment to sustainability and community impact Generous benefits and wellness resources Growth opportunities and mentorship programs
cons: Honestly, very few. Like any fast-paced company, priorities can shift quickly‚Äîbut it's part of what keeps the work exciting. If you're looking for a place where you can grow, make a difference, and work with incredible people, Prologis is it.

title: Great Company
pros: Culture is great. Coworkers are amazing. Great Benefits as well.
cons: Lots of data just floating in the ether. Sometimes if you ask two people the same question related to data, the answers will be different if retrieved from internal database.

title: 10/10 company to work for
pros: Company culture, career advancement/upward mobility, seamless cross team communication, trust instilled in employees
cons: None come to mind, truly a great place to work!

title: A great company to work for!
pros: Career growth opportunities, fast-paced company, engagement and support for the employee resource groups, great benefits, transparent leadership, very nice offices, passionate and driven employees
cons: It's a lean organization which has its pros and cons at times

title: Could have been so much more...
pros: Great management style (not micromanaged) Encourages/allows work from home/telecommunting Compensation is very competitive Great benefits
cons: Too much emphasis on checking boxes Often times too conservative in taking risks Too many senior managers are trying to drive process but either fail to align or take too long to align.

title: Great people to work with and encouraging culture of learning
pros: -The people -Pay -Culture -Professional growth
cons: -in office mandate -long commute

title: Best Company Ever!
pros: Great culture, brilliant and hardwokring colleagues, thoughtful leadership, entrepreneurial spirit, great benefits
cons: Nothing worth noting company wide

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Very intentional about creating a culture of hardworking people that work well with others and fit the culture that has been created. There are a lot of opportunities for growth, as there are a lot of business units within our Industrial Real Estate business.
cons: While Prologis industry leading and very intentional about diverse hiring while pursuing the most qualified individuals for the job, diversity is still low and is consistent with the industrial real estate industry.

title: Great Company to Work For!
pros: Prologis genuinely cares about its employees and is committed to supporting their growth and success. If you're looking for a company that invests in your career development, offers stability, and promotes a healthy work-life balance, this is the place to be.
cons: I genuinely have no complaints - everything about my experience here has been positive.

title: Amazing Company *ACTUALLY* Focused on Culture
pros: The perks of being a Prologis employee are the ability to work with people who enjoy their job. Not necessarily every detail, but on the whole, there are more people who enjoy coming to the office here, than any place I've ever worked.
cons: We don't own enough properties that I cannot bring all of my favorite co-workers from other previous employers to join me here.

title: Excellent Company with Top-of-the-Line Culture and People!
pros: Prologis provides us with consistent support, positive interactive feedback and industry leading opportunities for growth. The Life / Work balance is phenomenal. We all benefit from unmatched flexibility which translates into a very productive environment. Teamwork is awesome, so many fantastic people working together. Mentorship opportunities build our talent and benefit us as employees and our company.
cons: There can always be improvement no matter how good we are. Communication is key to providing answers for any challenges that we face. If anything, I feel that we could be even more open to searching out positive solutions to our pain points and quickly initiating those changes.

title: Clique
pros: Good pay and nice offices
cons: people very cliquey, not kind

title: Best Culture period. Purpose-Driven and People-First
pros: Prologis has created a workplace that blends accountability with autonomy. The culture is hard to beat‚Äîfun, hardworking, down-to-earth, and rooted in doing the right thing. Everyone‚Äîfrom leadership to peers‚Äîgenuinely cares about making a positive impact. We're encouraged to be ourselves, take smart risks, and support one another. It's fast-paced, but fun, and a shared sense of pride in leaving the world better than we found it. The global scope of the business adds exciting meaning to the work. You feel part of something much bigger than yourself, with real impact felt across communities.
cons: Like any high-performing environment, things move quickly. Those who prefer a slower pace or a lot of handholding may find it challenging. You‚Äôll thrive here if you‚Äôre self-motivated and collaborative.

title: A solid place to grow
pros: Prologis is a great company to gain valuable experience, grow professionally, and continuously learn. The organization is committed to innovation and operational efficiency, always seeking ways to improve. What truly stands out is the emphasis on aligning people with roles that play to their strengths, enabling both individual and team success.
cons: The environment is fast-paced and constantly evolving, which can be challenging for those who prefer more stability or structure.

title: Amazing place to work!
pros: Beautiful offices all over the world Great culture and leaders Smart people, lots of innovators Opportunities to grow or move around the company
cons: Middle management could use more training Upper management could encourage more of a work/life balance

title: Great company but the burnout is real
pros: They are a great company that is at the center of many innovative things. There are opportunities for advancement and your team will always help facilitate any movement if needed. Your managers and especially mine are knowledgeable and will do their best to help you succeed.
cons: The burnout is real. So much work to do and so much outside of your typical responsibilities that keep you from getting to your day to day.

title: Time Flies when you love what you do
pros: It‚Äôs true‚Äîtime flies when you enjoy what you‚Äôre doing. The work is meaningful, the team is supportive, and the culture is collaborative and inclusive. What makes it even more rewarding is the real impact we have on the communities we serve. Grateful to be part of something that matters.
cons: Lean organization with limited career advancement opportunities, but offers strong learning experiences and personal growth.

title: The best place I've worked
pros: You get to work with some of the smartest and best people in the industry who focus on innovation and results but also care about you. It's rare to find a company that genuinely cares about doing the right thing as much as it cares about being successful. Prologis is the best place I've ever worked.
cons: Prologis runs lean and is a flat organization so rapid upward mobility is not always an option.

title: Industry Leader
pros: Great culture and innovative atmosphere
cons: Understand your department wisely and career growth

title: Amazing Company, Amazing Culture
pros: Ability to be creative and drive change. Upper management is open to ideas to make the company better & encourages such.
cons: Some of the work can be intense. The cycles can be tough. Like long nights & weekends. But this is typically short bursts and things always settle, and time off to recover is encouraged.

title: Innovative, Inclusive and Inspiring Workplace!
pros: Having been at Prologis for over 10 years, I can confidently say this company has provided me with incredible career growth opportunities. From day one, I have been surrounded by talented, driven professionals who challenge and inspire me to do my best. The culture here is second to none‚Äîcollaborative, innovative, and supportive of employees at all levels. Compensation has always been fair and competitive, reflecting both market standards and the value the company places on its people. Being part of the industry leader in logistics real estate has been an exciting journey, and I am proud to contribute to a company that continually strives for excellence.
cons: Hard to state anything negative- Prologis is the best!

title: Chill work environment
pros: Definitely love the environment and very knowledgeable coworkers.
cons: I would say the pay is not that competitive.

title: People-First Company with a Genuine Culture
pros: Well rounded benefits package, generous PTO, and other employee perks that support overall well-being. Strong leadership ‚Äì executives are approachable, communicative, and genuinely invested in employee success. Friendly, collaborative employees ‚Äì coworkers are supportive and foster a team-oriented environment.
cons: Work can be fast-paced and occasionally stressful, especially during peak periods or when juggling multiple priorities.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Challenging work, collaborative environment, flexibility, talented team with shared vision for success. Management values employees and encourages innovation and efficiency, keeping us Ahead of What's Next.
cons: Relatively high stress and pressure at times.

title: People love it here
pros: Great culture, terrific leadership and the company has bold ambitions worldwide. An inspiring place to work and colleagues treat each other with respect.
cons: There is a lot to do!

title: Talented team and forward-thinking culture
pros: I work with highly competent people who take pride in what they do. There‚Äôs a strong push to stay ahead of the technology curve, which keeps the work fresh and challenging. I‚Äôm consistently encouraged to develop new skills and explore innovative solutions‚Äîespecially in the Microsoft ecosystem. Leadership is technically aware and open to modern approaches.
cons: Inter-departmental communication could be stronger. Sometimes, alignment between teams takes longer than necessary and leads to duplicated efforts or unclear responsibilities. While the intention is good, some cross-team processes could be streamlined.

title: Fantastic Company!
pros: Executive management is very proactive on being transparent to everyone on a frequent basis.
cons: istent branding and processes across all regions and groups considering we are a global company. Offers great work and life balance and terrific office amenities.

title: Thriving in a Supportive and Dynamic Work Environment
pros: Fantastic company that values it's employees, fostering a positive and inclusive workplace. One of the stand-out aspects is the leadership - management genuinely cares about employees well being and professional development. The work environment is dynamic and inspiring with a perfect balance of professionalism and teamwork.
cons: Based on my experience there are no cons for me working here at Prologis.

title: Great place to work
pros: Love working at a large company that feels small!
cons: Many people need to be involved in decision making

title: Great Place to Work
pros:
They Walk the Walk
Strong Benefits
Opportunity for Advancement
cons: A couple of antiquated software systems

title: Great Company....
pros: Wonderful company culture and oh so many perks.
cons: Endless meetings and at times unrealistic deadlines.

title: Prologis is an innovative, rock solid place to work
pros: We're constantly trying new things, pushing boundaries, learning new technologies, and looking for ways to automate. Additionally, the company is well positioned for the coming years. They also have a great working environment, nice people who are also highly intelligent, and excellent benefits.
cons: The workload gets heavy at times. It's difficult to expand and grow teams at times, especially with local resources.

title: Great culture, vision, and values
pros: Leadership does an amazing job being ahead of the industry in vision and goals. Truly globally minded organization. Exciting place to work with ripe opportunities for those who are interested. Culture of openness and honest principles - not just corporate speak around fanciful ideologies.
cons: Hard work culture, driven by insistence of excellence, which is not necessarily a bad thing but could lead to burn out especially with resource constraints and headcount limits.

title: Great Company with Great Culture
pros: Growth company that is geographically diverse with many opportunities for career growth. Likes to promote from within. Employee culture is fantastic, with the team being the focus. Good compensation and support from the company.
cons: Fast paced, even in the "slow" times, workloads can be overwhelming.

title: Great place to work
pros: - visionary leadership - growth industry - incredible bench strength - innovative - small employee base for a company of this size - steady, seasoned leaders - willingness to take chances - focus on hiring the best talent
cons: - because many employees stay at the company so long, promotion opportunities can be limited

title: Pretty Good
pros: Really good, benefits, culture & people
cons: Work/life balance is not always honored.

title: A Phenomenal Place to Work: Prologis, Leading the Future of Logistics Real Estate
pros: Working at Prologis is an incredible experience! The company‚Äôs forward-thinking leadership is truly inspiring, with a clear vision of transforming the logistics real estate industry. Management here doesn‚Äôt just support‚Äîthey actively encourage innovation, and every day you feel like you're part of something that's reshaping the future. If you're looking for a company where innovation meets opportunity, with a supportive team that genuinely cares, Prologis is the place to be. I couldn‚Äôt be more proud to contribute to a company that's constantly evolving and always leading from the front!
cons: Its not for an average 9-5'er, Its a very high performing team. You will be pushed to grow, think outside of the box, accept change and be a champion of it - a way maker!

title: Great stable company
pros: The stability of Prologis is one small piece of what makes this a great place to work.
cons: Very few cons, has great benefits.

title: Career at Prologis
pros: Some say its old fashioned to spend your career at one company but my 23+ years at Prologis has been rewarding in so many ways. I've had work life balance raising a family, my colleagues are life long friends, my bosses encourage me and my company supports me and gives me opportunities and training whenever I lean in for more. I especially appreciate the company's culture of giving back with time and funds supporting education, environment and community support which is important to me personally. The company has a global day of service (IMPACT Day) where all employees around the world volunteer on the same day, + gives employees 32 hours a year to volunteer, + Matching Gifts, + Dollars 4 Doers program. You can never go wrong spending a career that fulfills you both professionally and personally at one company if it's a company like Prologis.
cons: Prologis is always striving to be Ahead of What's Next so staying on top of your game, learning, growing and contributing in a big way can be a challenge and rewarding.

title: Collaborative. Inventive. Empowered. Global. Customer Driven.
pros: 10 Years at Prologis! Over that time, we have more than doubled in size of our real estate portfolio, we've expanded into multiple new business lines, we've set the most ambitious net zero climate goals in the industry. I love how this company continues to evolve its strategy to meet our customers end goals. Personally, my career has taken many step changes over the decade, expanding from a local market role to a global one with more engaging and strategic customer face time. Prologis is a place for a career, not just a job. World class organization and team!
cons: Demanding work environment! Great culture, but the expectation is for teammates is to roll up their sleeves, work hard and show passion. Not a great fit for people looking to coast.

title: Would give 6 stars if I could
pros: - Smart, caring leaders - Interesting work - Fantastic culture
cons: - So much to do, so little time - Meeting heavy

title: not what it once was
pros: your peers typically are close knit people and great to work with
cons: overworked, underpaid. they went from valuing the employees to just be purely focusing on noi which in turn has caused a major uptick in employee turnover due to burn out. additionally, the new ops director turned what was once a great culture into a toxic one. if you value your mental health, stay away.

title: Good benefits, stable company
pros: Decent WLB, depending on team of course. Good benefits
cons: Lots of red tape, tough to get things done across teams.

title: Why I Chose Prologis
pros: Prologis remains the best employer I have worked for. I started as temp nearly 12 years ago and within my first week I decided that I wanted to work for and retire from this company. Luckily they wanted me as much as I wanted them. The culture, values and commitment to excellence were evident then and continue to be so today. The sense of pride I continue to feel in our shared values - integrity, mentorship, passion, accountability, courage and teamwork - is why I stay. It is a rare opportunity to find a company that aligns so closely with one's personal values.
cons: After 12 years of employment here the pros heavily outweigh the cons. The pace for professional advancement - especially on the operations side of our business is slow and often frustrating. Opportunities for promotions are not easy to come by.

title: A solid company that really tries hard to do its best
pros: Heavy investment in talent development A culture that includes elements of fun and team bonding Great opportunities for promotion
cons: The pace can feel too fast sometimes

title: Growth Opportunities and Supportive Leadership
pros: The company offers great opportunities for personal and professional growth. Leadership is very supportive, open to feedback, and encourages an environment where we feel valued and heard. The collaborative culture and teamwork make it a positive place to work.
cons: Like many roles, the workload can sometimes become demanding, especially during busy periods. Meeting tight deadlines can be stressful at times, but with a supportive leadership team, these challenges are manageable. Improving certain internal processes could help alleviate some of the pressure.

title: Good place to work
pros: The company is full of smart, high performing people.
cons: The workload and pace can be exhausting

title: Always something new to get involved in and be at the forefront of
pros: Prologis offers a dynamic and inclusive work environment where innovation and collaboration are at the forefront of everything we do. The company provides ample opportunities for growth in and above your role, with a strong focus on professional development and career advancement. With a commitment to sustainability, community engagement, and employee well-being, Prologis fosters a culture that values both individual contributions and teamwork. There is a strong emphasis during the interview process on identifying candidates that make a good team and cultural fit to ensure collegiality and longevity of employment with the company - this is evident in how many people you speak with have been with the company 5, 10, 20 years. The company‚Äôs global reach and dedication to industry leadership make it an exciting place to build an impactful career and be at the forefront of a fast growing industry.
cons: Workload can sometimes be very overwhelming

title: THE BEST PLACE TO WORK..
pros: Prologis is more than just a workplace; it feels like going to your own office, where your voice and opinions truly matter. As a global leader in logistics real estate, Prologis fosters a culture of innovation, diversity, and inclusion, ensuring that everyone can contribute meaningfully. The company‚Äôs commitment to sustainability and community involvement allows employees to make a positive impact. With strong career growth opportunities, a supportive environment, and a focus on work-life balance, Prologis is a place where you can bring your true self and thrive both personally and professionally.
cons: If you work at Prologis, you'll be so spoiled, no other company will ever measure up! You'll wonder how you ever settled for anything less. üòÑ

title: A company to grow with
pros: - working with colleagues who really feel like a second family - lots of opportunity to learn and grow within the company. There are people in this organization who are 10+, 15+ and even 20+ years here; they are a wealth of knowledge - Prologis embraces change and innovatoin - constantly adapting and trying new things before others in the industry. - Fun, diverse environment where I feel comfortable to voice my opinion and thoughts at any level and know I will be heard. - No day is the same - promotes a work-life balance with PTO and 3 summer 1/2 days. -encourages volunteer work and Prologis Impact Day
cons: - the work ebbs and flows, some days do feel heavier.

title: Reginal
pros: Prologis is an amazing place to work! The company is innovative, flexible, and filled with talented people who make every day exciting. There‚Äôs never a dull moment here, with constant opportunities for growth and learning. The compensation is excellent, and Prologis truly values its employees, always putting people first. Their customer-focused approach and inclusive culture create a positive, dynamic environment that makes you proud to be part of the team. If you want a company that cares about its people and pushes boundaries, Prologis is the place to be!
cons: Constant change ‚Äì The company‚Äôs focus on innovation means frequent changes in processes and goals, which can be hard for those who prefer stability. But I love it!

title: Company really takes care of us
pros: The company has excellent benefits and compensation for its employees. I feel very well supported by my management, and I appreciate the culture that senior leadership strives to spread throughout the organization.
cons: We get a certain amount of days every year that we get to volunteer. Everyone takes the day off to volunteer for IMPACT Day, but it can be difficult to find time to use the other volunteer days without a broader corporate effort.

title: Ahead of the pack
pros: The C-level leadership, including our CEO, CTO, CFO, CLO, and President, are visionary and supportive, cultivating a culture of excellence. As a founder-owned and managed company, Prologis remains deeply aligned with its core values. There is also a strong culture of giving back to our communities, which adds to the sense of purpose and fulfillment. As a global leader in real estate, Prologis is at the forefront of technology, making it an exciting place to work and grow. Highly recommend!
cons: Prologis is a Fortune 100 company with 2,500+ employees, so to thrive here, you need to be dedicated and think like a service owner. The environment is fast-paced and demanding, which can be challenging if you‚Äôre not ready to take ownership and drive results.

title: Superb culture, inspiring leaders and great benefits
pros: Prologis company culture is truly outstanding. People are hardworking, respect your work-life balance, encourage learning, welcome questions and much more. From Day 1, the people at Prologis made me feel like a part of the team. The company also offers competitive salary and great benefits.
cons: It is really hard for me to think of a con of working at Prologis. If I had to pick something, it (at this point in my first year with the company) could only be a meager complaint that the office is too cold.

title: Over 2 decades of job satisfaction
pros: I love the company culture, the benefits, and the fact that we are constantly leading the industry in how we operate and strive to keep our customers happy.
cons: Part of being a leader in the industry means a lot of initiatives, change, testing and scrapping ideas, data collection -- it's a busy place!

title: Company culture has changed
pros: Great office views and fun people to work with
cons: Company culture has changed negatively, lots of budget cuts and management is not transparent

title: One of the Best Companies I've Ever Worked For
pros: #1 is the culture at Prologis. People are kind and generally trying their best. We work hard but we pause to have fun. I also love that each region has their own sub-culture that makes it fun to visit, learn, and collaborate. Leadership has a vision for the company and genuinely cares about its people. The company is headed in the right direction. Some of the newer departments are still in startup mode figuring things out and can be messier, but there are a lot of things to be excited about and customers are overall happy with the products/services offered. Prologis is a company that practices what it preaches. We actually, seriously, care about ESG and reducing our impact on the environment, compared to other places I've been where it looks more like greenwashing. I feel well compensated for my work, and for the most part my work/life balance is fantastic. It helps that we get lots of vacation time (that I actually feel comfortable taking) and even a few days off per year to volunteer.
cons: I would love to see more diversity in exec leadership roles (women, POC, and age) for fresh perspective. But I will say this has improved even in the few years that I've been here, and DEI is a newer group that has been established. As a global company, we have the challenge of communicating across geographies, time zones, and languages. We do a better job than even some smaller companies I've worked for, but still have some room to improve here.

title: A company that I admire and appreciate and colleagues I enjoy working with
pros: Generally a pretty progressive and innovative workplace that is always trying to make itself better. Diversity in thought and employee base. At the heart of it, you can tell they care about the employees and culture. A focus on community service and environmental impact. A lot of direct communication from the top leaders which makes them feel more accessible. Wonderful colleagues to work with.
cons: There can be limited job mobility options depending on your goals. An innovation focus sometimes leads to a lot of initiatives.

title: Good company to work for
pros: Cares about employees well being and development
cons: Little opportunity for upward mobility

title: Great company, people and culture
pros: * Work is interesting and makes an impact on the world * People are great * Leadership is accessible and engaged * Strong culture * World-class offices
cons: Work/life balance can be a challenge but given the pace of our world and how technology has blurred the lines between work and home, I think this is the case for most corp jobs. The modern way of working means it can be tough to unplug and keep the work moving forward.

title: Current Employee
pros: Great culture and benefits. Respectful and knowledgeable managers. Opportunities to further your career are available.
cons: Collaboration between departments is necessary but needs to be improved. Company news communication

title: Yes- It really is one of the best places to work
pros: The people are great to work with and have genuine engagement and are excited to be at work. It seems like a smaller company, as an employee you feel like your wellbeing is a priority.
cons: There are times when the work life balance can be off, but that's not a consistent event, but has to do with the inevitability of uneven workload over the course of the year.

title: An Exceptional Workplace Where Excellence Thrives
pros: Diverse and dynamic work environment. Opportunities for skill development. Supportive and collaborative team. Varied daily challenges and tasks. Strong company culture and values.
cons: Demanding workload and multitasking. Repetitive tasks at times. Stressful deadline-driven responsibilities. Occasional long working hours. Limited opportunities for creativity.

title: Walking the Walk with Culture and Values
pros: - Incredibly kind, passionate people -Commitment and action related to ESG, as well as diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging - Focus on embracing change and doing things differently
cons: - Leaders don't effectively model a healthy work-life balance - Health insurance options are surprisingly very limited given company size - The company lives by innovation, but at times decisions feel more influenced by leaders' personal preferences

title: Great culture, secret gem
pros: The people are truly, genuinely great. Leadership is open to criticism, willing to change. Big ambitions in sustainability / reducing carbon footprint at scale. Real goals around equal pay, diversity and inclusion. Proactive, hard-working people.
cons: Very fast-paced company. Some parts of the business are still very old school (it's real estate). Technology needs an upgrade -- employees have way too many disconnected tools and platforms.

title: Great Employer!!
pros: The majority of people I‚Äôve worked with are so knowledgeable and willing to collaborate. There‚Äôs always something new to learn and constant opportunities to develop my skillset.
cons: Can be really fast paced. The business sometimes moves faster than accounting can adjust to their requests. Lack of communication between departments is a struggle.

title: Great place to work, awesome culture, and innovative company
pros: Prologis is a great place to work and leader in the industry. Our leadership team drives a thriving, focused culture to perform and meet / exceed market expectations
cons: As with any company, remote and spread out working makes community harder but Prologis seeks to pull together virtually as best possible with initiatives like our IMPACT days.

title: Fun Real Estate Company
pros: Prologis takes care of its employees first and that goes a long way in so many ways.
cons: You will worry on having a boring time at work because you won't have any.

title: Excellent Company
pros: Prologis provides employees with resources and trust to succeed. The people at Prologis are intelligent, approachable, and professional. Everyone cares about doing the right thing and has a competitive spirit for success.
cons: The performance rating scale can be difficult to understand.

title: Nearly three years in
pros: - GREAT people - non-hierarchal mindset - interesting work - compensation / benefits - room to grow and move up
cons: Company is growing fast. Hope the inclusive, collaborative and supportive environment remains intact

title: Fun place to work
pros: Smart people, wide variety of things to be involved in, flexible culture
cons: Fast-paced, but I enjoy that

title: The best people = a great company!
pros: Top notch people, excellent leadership and industry leading business practices.
cons: I dont really see cons for working at Prologis. Its a great company to work for!

title: Strong culture, great people
pros: Strong company culture. Very talented and dedicated people who are great to work with.
cons: Work life balance is tough at times but not always.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great people and culture, willingness to invest in innovation/new ideas, and strong focus on sustainability.
cons: Relatively small workforce size can mean slower career progression in some functions.

title: Committed to excellence
pros: Strong commitment to walking the walk and being the best in class
cons: Organizations can be a little silo'd with similar functions doing things differently

title: Takes great care of employees
pros: Lots of perks including great benefits, team building events, culture, etc
cons: Since it is a global company, policies sometimes seem politically driven

title: A job
pros: You get paid on time
cons: The company is full of people who don't know how to do their jobs.

title: Great company for agile, hard-workers
pros: Prologis is truly a world-class organization. The CEO and Founder, Hamid is a industry visionary, helping Prologis to become the global leader in industrial real estate. He leads with a confidence and thoughtfulness that inspires. On a more micro level, the individual support is excellent. The office community is friendly and helpful, with an excellent balance of hard work and fun. If you are a strong, hard-working person, you will succeed here. Folks who are not naturally driven would likely struggle.
cons: Development work can be stressful, but that's an industry issue, not a company issue. The company is strongly focused on innovation. However, we tend to roll out initiatives before they're thoroughly tested. Instead of adopting feedback readily, it can be a painful process to provide feedback on a failed initiative during launch with leadership requesting that you "prove your case" instead of taking more formal note of feedback during early launch or testing. Too many of these processes add work without value and tasks to an already complicated workday.

title: Amazing place to work!!!!
pros: The culture is collaborative, innovative and supportive. Leadership is so amazing; they are dedicated to your success. They are so approachable and really take time to listen. They take feedback and react to it quickly. They are dedicated to their sustainability goals and their community involvement. They encourage a healthy work/life balance. They have a great mentor program for anyone that wants to grow professionally or personally.
cons: I currently can't think of any cons.
